place.name: CORSTON
place.gazetteerText: CORSTON, a parish in Keynsham district, Somerset: on the Great Western railway, adjacent to the river Avon, about a mile SW of Saltford r. station, and 3¾ W of Bath. Post town, Twerton, under Bath. Acres, 1, 190. Real property, £2, 730. Pop., 472. Houses, 103. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Bath-and Wells. Value, £150.* Patron, the Bishop of Bath and Wells. The church is early English; consists of nave and chancel, with a tower; and is in good condition. There are chapels for Wesleyans and Primitive Methodists, and charities £15. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
